text: Citi rewards earn 10 Thank you points per dollar. 10 TY points can be converted to 4 miles.If you choose Citi rewards  base on your spending pattern  you need to get Amaze card.

Hi all  i am currently using uob one credit card and SC unlimited cashback card.Would like to ask how can i pair either card to get good rates for spending overseas (similar to trust card) and still earn cashback?I understand topping up to wallet  such as youtrip  is excluded
If u want good rate then have to consider other cards pair with amaze  or top up amaze wallet. Uob one is visa hence ‚ùå

U can pair sc unlimited (now renamed as simply cash) with amaze.Although:1.5% cashback - 2.5% amaze cost + 0.5% amaze points = net 0.5% loss/costU might want to consider using higher (but more troublesome) Mastercards that give higher cash back if mcc matches.

Citi Rewards with Amaze should work but not sure if extra 1% fee. HSBC Revo no
If you have UOB PPV also can.
But actually what is the benefit of paying with amaze linked for sg transactions? Citi rewards will still get bonus points if i use directly right?
Amaze converts offline spending to online spending  reason why you can get 4mpd. Dental MCC is not part of offline whitelist so you cannot use directly.

Hi  I have applied for the DBS altitude Amex card. have signed up for the card via dbs digibanking and and received the card on 31st Jan. Recalled seeing on milelion that there was a promo going on where I can get 16k miles if I spend $2k within 1 month with no annual fees. But the promo has been removed from the website on milelion and singsaver now. I called dbs to ask if I am still eligible for the promo. Was told that if I could provide the promo code  they can add it into the system for me. Does anyone know what is the promo code for this ?
With a quick search with "dbs altitude promo"  I found this:https://t.me/HMSGHive/1358I don't think there's any promo for DBS Altitude after 31 Nov 23.

Hi guys  can I ask whether do your know why CPF deducted lesser for investment? Eg; if you choose 20k from your OA to invest in T bills  but why they did not deduct 20k but deducted slightly lesser? Is it there is a cost somewhere?
At maturity  your amount will go up to $20k  the difference being your interest
T bills pay you the interest upfront  as a discount to your initial investment value

does this mean that whatever i invested  then the interest they supposedly will give at maturity will be minus off first? then they deduct that amt from CPF. and at maturity  the returns will be back to the amt i invested?
Yes youll get back the original amount you invested  e.g. 20k
Hi all  last December I was busy so I paid my cc bill without checking my statement. Now I found that there's an annual fee and it's gst charges. Is it too late for me to waive it?
Just request for waiver and you'll see the refund in the current statement month
